Senior Product Designer, Marketplace Core

at Spotify in New York, NY from 2/21/2021

Partner closely with product managers and engineers to better understand opportunities and gaps within our internally-facing teams and turn insights into meaningful results.
Be the voice of both our internal and external customers, working alongside our engineers and product managers during systems development.
Solve complicated technical problems and find tooling solutions for our multi-disciplinary teams, so that our squads have the liberty to adapt quickly and innovate.
Collaborate with internal partners throughout both business and R&D, while considering requirements, constraints, user needs, and business goals.
Craft sophisticated but practical solutions to design challenges by partnering closely with engineering, product, and business folks.
Partner with other designers to build and align on a coherent user experience, while also considering business and technical requirements for various product offerings.
Develop sketches, wireframes, and prototypes to validate concepts and hypotheses with our end users.
Build, disseminate, and maintain systems documentation.
Be autonomous and take full ownership of your work on every last detail, every step of the way.

Responsibilities

You have 5+ years of experience in design, with a focus on either Enterprise UX, B2B products, and/or internally-facing products. You also have a portfolio or PDF that you can share with us to reflect that work.
You are passionate about discovering new tooling solutions for both internal and external customers, with a particular interest in supporting Spotify’s artist-facing product teams.
You’re an outstanding teammate, communicator and facilitator. You have the communication skills and people-focused design mentality to help set up frameworks and brainstorm initial design concepts.
You excel at collaborating and working within agile, engineering-focused teams, usually as the only designer.
You’ve planned design sprints and structured workshops that drive outcomes quickly and optimally. You’re familiar with standard practices, but are just as comfortable challenging them.
A systems-thinker and problem solver who can connect the dots between various user groups and industry workflows, and turn them into impactful design solutions.
A great storyteller and communicator, you’re able to translate complex systems and frameworks into concepts that are easy to understand for a variety of audiences.
You use both quantitative and qualitative data sources to inform your design decisions and are a hands-on UX Designer proficient in user research techniques, interaction design, and information architecture.
